quizzes.title: General Language Knowledge
quizzes.description: Test your overall language skills with this comprehensive WordBridge quiz.

questions.question: Which word is closest in meaning to 'ubiquitous'?
questions.explanation: Ubiquitous means present everywhere or found everywhere at the same time.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: I have been to Paris last year.
I went to Paris last year.
I have went to Paris last year.
I was going to Paris last year.
questions.explanation: When referring to a specific time in the past ('last year'), use simple past tense, not present perfect.

questions.question: What is the past participle of 'choose'?
questions.explanation: The past participle of 'choose' is 'chosen'. The past tense is 'chose'.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the subjunctive mood correctly?
options: If I was rich, I would travel the world.
If I were rich, I would travel the world.
If I am rich, I would travel the world.
If I will be rich, I would travel the world.
questions.explanation: The subjunctive mood uses 'were' instead of 'was' in hypothetical situations, regardless of the subject.

questions.question: What does 'procrastinate' mean?
questions.explanation: Procrastinate means to delay or postpone action; to put off doing something.

questions.question: Which sentence is grammatically correct?
options: Neither of the students were present.
Neither of the students was present.
Neither of the student was present.
Neither of the student were present.
questions.explanation: 'Neither' is singular and requires a singular verb 'was'. The object of the preposition is 'students' (plural).

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is allergic ___ cats.'
questions.explanation: The correct phrase is 'allergic to' - we use 'to' after 'allergic' to indicate what causes the allergic reaction.

questions.question: What is a synonym for 'ephemeral'?
questions.explanation: Ephemeral means lasting for a very short time, so 'temporary' is the closest synonym.

questions.question: Which sentence uses the apostrophe correctly?
options: The dog's are playing in the park.
The dogs' are playing in the park.
The dogs are playing in the park.
The dog's playing in the park.
questions.explanation: No apostrophe is needed here. 'Dogs' is simply the plural form of 'dog', not possessive or a contraction.

questions.question: Complete the idiom: 'It's raining cats and ___'
questions.explanation: The idiom 'It's raining cats and dogs' means it's raining very heavily.

questions.question: Which word is an antonym of 'diligent'?
Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: 'She doesn't like apples.' is grammatically correct.

questions.question: What does 'serendipity' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Serendipity' means a happy or beneficial accident.

questions.question: What is the past tense of 'run'?
Which word means 'fond of company'?
questions.explanation: 'Gregarious' means sociable or fond of company.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'He is interested ___ music.'
Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: 'Fewer' is used with countable nouns like 'people'.

questions.question: What is the comparative form of 'good'?
Which word means 'lasting for a very short time'?
questions.explanation: 'Ephemeral' means lasting for a very short time.

questions.question: Choose the correct sentence:
options: He go to school every day.
He goes to school every day.
He going to school every day.
He gone to school every day.
questions.explanation: 'He goes to school every day.' is correct.

questions.question: Which is a synonym for 'resilient'?
questions.explanation: 'Resilient' means strong and able to recover quickly.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is afraid ___ spiders.'
What is the past tense of 'choose'?
Which sentence is correct?
options: Neither of the students were present.
Neither of the students was present.
Neither of the student was present.
Neither of the student were present.
questions.explanation: 'Neither' is singular and requires a singular verb 'was'.

questions.question: Which is a synonym for 'lucid'?
questions.explanation: 'Lucid' means clear and easy to understand.

questions.question: What is the superlative form of 'bad'?
Choose the correct sentence:
questions.explanation: 'She has finished her work.' is correct.

questions.question: Which word means 'to delay or postpone'?
Choose the correct preposition: 'He is good ___ math.'
Which word means 'lasting for a very short time'?
questions.explanation: 'Ephemeral' means lasting for a very short time.

questions.question: What is the past tense of 'swim'?
What does 'lucid' mean?
questions.explanation: 'Lucid' means clear and easy to understand.

questions.question: Choose the correct preposition: 'She is fond ___ chocolate.'
What is the past tense of 'write'?
Which sentence is correct?
questions.explanation: 'They have finished their homework.' is correct.
